<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
<description type="note">Title: The appearance to Mary Magdalen.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

Maria magdalene goth to Ã¾e graue and wepyth and seyth Maria Magdalen Ffor hertyly Sorwe myn herte doth breke with wepynge terys I wasch my face Alas ffor sorwe I may not speke my lorde is gon Ã¾at here-inne wase Myn owyn dere lorde and kyng of gras Ã¾at vij develys ffro me dyd take I kan nat se hym Alas Alas he is stolyn awey owt of Ã¾is lake. Aungelus Woman Ã¾at stondyst here Alone Why dost Ã¾out wepe and morne and wepe so sore What cawse hast Ã¾ou to make such mone Why makyst Ã¾ou such sorwe and where-fore. Maria Magdalene I haue gret cawse to wepe evyr more my lord is take out of his graue Stolyn Awey and fro me lore I kan not wete where hym to haue. hic parum deambulet A sepulcro dicens Alas Alas what xal I do my lord awey is fro me take A woful wrecche whedyr xal I go My joye is gon owth of Ã¾is lake. Jhesus Woman suche mornynge why dost Ã¾ou make Why is Ã¾i chere so hevy and badde Why dost Ã¾ou sythe so sore and qwake Why dost Ã¾ou wepe so sore and sadde. Maria Magdalene A grettyr cawse had nevyr woman Ffor to wepe both nyth and day than I myself haue in serteyn for to sorwyn evyr and Ay Alas ffor sorwe myn hert doth blede my lorde is take fro me A-way I muste nedys sore wepe and grede where he is put I kan not say. but jentyl gardener I pray to the If Ã¾ou hym took out of his graue telle me qwere I may hym se Ã¾at I may go my lorde to haue. Jhesus spectans M. A. R. I. A. Maria Magdalene A mayster and lorde to Ã¾e I crave As Ã¾ou art lord and kynge of blys Graunt me lord and Ã¾ou vowchesave thyn holy ffete Ã¾at I may kys. Jhesus Towche me not As ?ett Mary Ffor to my fadyr I haue not Ascende but to my bretheryn in hast Ã¾e hy? with these gode wurdys here care Amende Sey to my bretheryn Ã¾at I intende to stey to my fadyr and to ?owre to oure lord both god and frende I wyl Ascende to hevyn towre. In hevyn to ordeyn ?ow A place to my ffadyr now wyl I go to merth and joye and grett solace And endeles blys to brynge ?ow to Ffor man I sufferyd both schame and wo more spyteful deth nevyr man dyd take ?it wyl I ordeyn ffor all this lo In hevyn an halle for mannys sake. Maria Magdaly[n] Gracyous lord at ?our byddyng to all my bretheryn I xal go telle how Ã¾at ?e be man levynge quyk and qwethynge of flesch and ffelle Now all hevynes I may expelle And myrth and joy now take to me my lord Ã¾at I haue louyd so wele with opyn syght I dede hym se. Whan I sowght my lord in grave I was fful sory and ryght sad Ffor syght of hym I myght non haue Ffor mornynge sore I was nere mad Grettere sorwe ?it nevyr whith had Whan my lord A-wey was gon But now in herte I am so glad so grett a joy nevyr wyff had non. how myght I more gretter joye haue than se Ã¾at lorde with opyn syght the whiche my sowle from synne to saue From develys sefne he made me qwyght. There kan no tounge my joye expres now I haue seyn my lorde on lyve to my bretheryn I wyl me dresse and telle to hem A-non ryght be-lyve With opyn speche I xal me shryve and telle to hem with wurdys pleyn how Ã¾at cryst ffrom deth to lyve to endles blys is resyn Ageyn. Bretheryn all bllyth ?e be ffor joyful tydyngys tellyn I kan I saw oure lord cryst lyste wel to me of flesch and bon quyk levynge man beth glad and joyful as for than Ffor trost me trewly it is ryght thus Mowth to mowth Ã¾is sertayn I spak ryght now with cryst jhesus. Petrus A woundyrful tale for-sothe is this ever onowryd oure lorde mote be we pray Ã¾e lord and kynge of blys Onys Ã¾i presence Ã¾at we may se Ere thu Ascende to thi mageste Gracyous god if Ã¾at ?e plese late us haue sum syght of the oure careful hertys to sett in ease Amen. Explicit apparicio Marie magdale[ne.]
